column4: What is the easiest way to create a new *default* fstab file? note, there is no backup of the original available.
pastebin the output of sudo fdisk -l and I can try to write you an fstab
you'll need to know the mount points of your partitions though if yo uhave many
I know the mount points, I don't have the fdisk -l output available at this moment though, but I have it memorized
